definition: Wanquan county in Zhangjiakou 張家口|张家口[Zhang1 jia1 kou3], Hebei
absolutely safe/surefire/thorough
surname Wan
ten thousand/a great number
all/whole/entire/every/complete
surname Quan
Wanquan county in Zhangjiakou 張家口|张家口[Zhang1 jia1 kou3], Hebei

sentences.english: Before climbing it is BEST to be properly prepared, in case of any mishap.
sentences.chinese: 爬山之前最好有萬全的準備，以免發生山難。

sentences.english: because she had prepared for the interview thoroughly.
sentences.chinese: 因爲她已經爲這次面試做好了萬全的準備。

sentences.english: No system can be fully foolproof.
sentences.chinese: 沒有哪個系統是萬全的。

sentences.english: We hold a sure card to be practical.
sentences.chinese: 我們認爲萬全之策是切實可行的。

sentences.english: One surefire way to attract new customers and readers is to go outside of your existing niche boundaries.
sentences.chinese: 一個吸引新讀者和顧客的萬全之策就是跳出你的圈子。

sentences.english: We hold a sure card to be practicable.
sentences.chinese: 我們認爲萬全之策是切實可行的。

sentences.english: Lowering retail prices is no panacea.
sentences.chinese: 降低零售價並非萬全之計。

sentences.english: There are no absolute guarantees about what to do when it comes to choosing fruit.
sentences.chinese: 在挑選水果的時候，沒有什麼萬全之策。

sentences.english: Want a sure-fire way to improve your marriage?
sentences.chinese: 想要個提高婚姻質量的萬全之策？

sentences.english: Industrial Computing rarely has a "one size fits all" solution.
sentences.chinese: 工業電腦很少有“萬全之策”的解決辦法。

sentences.english: Flees completely safe causes Ding Luoshan to suspend the inspection, Liu Yong becomes acts bureau chief.
sentences.chinese: 萬全出逃導致丁洛山被停職檢查，劉勇成爲代理局長。

definition: lit. before it rains, bind around with silk (idiom, from Book of Songs 詩經|诗经); fig. to plan ahead/to prepare for a rainy day
countermeasure for dealing with a situation
surefire; absolutely safe (idiom)
to judge the hour and size up the situation/to take stock
to advise
meticulous/thorough/comprehensive/complete/detailed
to work out a strategy/to come up with a plan for
top priority job/matter of vital importance
to consider/to weigh (a matter)/to balance (pros and cons)
to sound out the difficulties and retreat to avoid defeat (idiom); fig. to back out of an awkward situation/to get out on finding out what it's really like
to be in overall charge/to oversee
to use up/to exhaust
variant of 勸誡|劝诫[quan4 jie4]
strict/serious/solemn/dignified/to tidy up/to clean up/to purge/to adjust
to offer advice/to make a suggestion
pragmatic/flexible/to act differently in different situations/to accommodate to circumstances
